mapper.select: select id, alarm_code, alarm_source, alarm_description, alarm_location, start_time, end_time, incident_type, alarm_level, fault_type, manufacturers, device_code, device_name, wind_farm, asset_number, order_number, alarm_status, operating_status, discoverer_id, discoverer_name, remark, create_time, create_user_id, create_user_name, update_time, update_user_id, update_user_name, tenant_domain from fault_information where alarm_status=0 and incident_type=2 order by start_time desc

select a.id, a.alarm_code, a.alarm_source, a.alarm_description, a.alarm_location, a.start_time, a.end_time, a.incident_type, a.alarm_level, a.fault_type, a.manufacturers, a.device_code, a.device_name, a.wind_farm, a.asset_number, a.order_number, a.alarm_status, a.operating_status, a.discoverer_id, a.discoverer_name, a.remark, a.create_time, a.create_user_id, a.create_user_name, a.update_time, a.update_user_id, a.update_user_name, a.tenant_domain, b.filePath from fault_information a left join ( select pid,group_concat(file_path separator ',') as filePath from fault_file_record group by pid ) b on a.id=b.pid where a.id= #{bean.id}
